description: Sedge (Carex annectens) is an amazing plant species. It is an extremely versatile, low-maintenance perennial that is great for naturalizing or using in water-savvy landscapes. The foliage of this plant is evergreen and fine-textured, providing excellent groundcover. The darker green clumps of foliage form dense mounds, with spiky, brush-like seed heads providing an interesting textural contrast. This species grows well in any soil type, making it ideal for container gardens or areas with poor soils. Sedge is also tolerant of wet conditions, making it the perfect choice for pond and bog garden designs. In addition, it is deer resistant and can even survive in light shade. All of these qualities make sedge an amazing plant for a variety of landscaping needs.
